bors d+

:v: pechersky can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10906611012/job/30268256571)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10906611012/job/30268256197)
I suggested a very minor golfing, apart from this LGTM.
I suggested a very minor golfing, apart from this LGTM.
Is `a - b < a ↔ b < a` also true? If so, it would be nice to have both.
Unfortunately, not true: `a := 1, b := 1; 0 < 1`  but `1 = 1`.

```suggestion
  by_cases h : a < b
```
but `constructor <;> intro h` might be more typical
Rearranged to use constructor
Why `simp_rw`?
Due to `rw` trying to rewrite inside `b : Fin (n + 1)`, and getting a `motive is not correct` error. Left a comment

```suggestion
    cases' n with n
  · exact a.elim0
  constructor
  · contrapose!
    intro h
    obtain ⟨l, hl⟩ := Nat.exists_eq_add_of_le (Fin.not_lt.mp h)
    simpa only [Fin.not_lt, le_iff_val_le_val, sub_def, hl, ← Nat.add_assoc, Nat.add_mod_left,
      Nat.mod_eq_of_lt, Nat.sub_add_cancel b.is_lt.le] using
        (le_trans (mod_le _ _) (le_add_left _ _))
  · intro h
    rw [lt_iff_val_lt_val, sub_def]
    simp only
    obtain ⟨k, hk⟩ := Nat.exists_eq_add_of_lt b.is_lt
    have : n + 1 - b = k + 1 := by
      simp_rw [hk, Nat.add_assoc, Nat.add_sub_cancel_left] 
      -- simp_rw because, otherwise, rw tries to rewrite inside `b : Fin (n + 1)`
    rw [this, Nat.mod_eq_of_lt (hk.ge.trans_lt' ?_), Nat.lt_add_left_iff_pos] <;>
    omega
```
This is a weird hybrid of hypotheses. Does `x : Fin (n + 2)` suffice?

```suggestion
lemma lt_one_iff {n : ℕ} (x : Fin (n + 2)) : x < 1 ↔ x = 0 := by
  simp [Fin.lt_iff_val_lt_val, Fin.ext_iff]
```
does indeed work

Not tested but should work AFAICT.
```suggestion
  rw [rev_eq_iff, rev_add, rev_rev]
```
Why do you need to special case `n = 0` here?
Should it be a `simp` lemma?
Same here.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Fin): lt_sub_iff, rev_{add,sub}
